author: nishant0
content:
A few bottlenecks are 
- Block propagation and validation
- Attestation Aggregation
- Relay communication having smaller deadlines

Currently all clients have a 4 second deadline before attesting to their current head. So blocks (+ blobs) need to be propagated to the whole network within this deadline in order for that block to be considered 'timely' . Given that we want to increase block sizes significantly via the gas limit , this is going to lead to longer propagation times. At just the current deadline this would push up the bandwidth requirements for all validators. By reducing the deadline this pushes it even higher. 

Same story for blobs / columns, we currently need to send all the data within this deadline and making it smaller  would push up bandwidth requirements again. 

On Attestation Aggregation , we might end up having worse aggregates with a shorter deadline so you could have blocks being packed with emptier aggregates. However its possible we will be *fine* , since attestations travel much better than blocks/blobs/columns , so the lower deadline doesn't have much of an effect. Need more benchmarking or data to confirm this at the current mainnet validator registry size. MaxEB makes this better with consolidation so that helps our case.

author: nishant0
content: I am not including execution time of both the CL/EL payload here , which probably makes it even harder. But the main worry is timely network propagation here of block/blobs/columns

author: jgm
content:
I would also point out that there is a big difference between having a network with (e.g.) constant 4 second slot times, and changing a network from 12 second slot times to 4 second slot times at some arbitrary point.  The idea that slot time is a constant is implicit across not just the consensus nodes but the ecosystem as a whole, and changing it at some point could cause significant knock-on effects.

If it were down me I would look at increasing the per-block gas limit and tweaking the slot intervals to give more time for block propagation and attesting (e.g. 5s for production, 5s for attesting, 2s for aggregating).  The latter is something that has already been discussed and wouldn't be as big a change as it would "only" require changes to consensus nodes.

If there is a desire for shorter slot times it would seem that putting this into something like beam chain would be a better option, where either a lower constant can be selected from genesis, or the design built with variable slot times in mind.
